message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and response to ibuprofen suggest that the underlying pathology is osteoarthritis. Ibuprofen inhibits the conversion of arachidonic acid to prostaglandin G2, which is an inflammatory mediator involved in the pathogenesis of osteoarthritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest osteoarthritis, and ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that inhibits cyclooxygenase (COX), an enzyme involved in the conversion of arachidonic acid to prostaglandin G2, which leads to inflammation and pain.

Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that inhibits the conversion of arachidonic acid to prostaglandin G2, which is responsible for the inflammatory response in osteoarthritis.
